title: Bug 27869: StyledText overuse of Font.getFontData
description: Bug 27869: StyledText overuse of Font.getFontData. Btw, UTF8 is the default English encoding for Redhat 8. FontMetrics API is also very used by the StyledText. I believe that the metric information should be cached in the StyledText and updated only when the font is changed.
OB: The Font.getFontData method in the StyledText class is being overused, impacting performance especially on platforms like Motif running on UTF8. This method is causing poor performance.
EB: The metric information in the StyledText class should be cached and updated only when the font is changed. This optimization will improve the performance of the StyledText component.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Add a 'System.out.println' statement in the first line of the 'getFontData' method.
2. Run a self-hosted Eclipse instance.
3. Observe the console for any impact on performance.
Keep in mind that this problem is more pronounced on platforms like Motif running on UTF8 encoding.
